Quiz.Title: Georgraphy Quiz
Quiz.Description: How good are you at US Geography?

Questions.QuestionText: Which US State shares its border with only one other state?

Answers.Explanation: Texas touches four other states: New Mexico, Oklahoma, Arkansas, and Louisiana
Washington touches two other states: Idaho and Oregon.

Questions.QuestionText: Which of the following states does the Mississippi River NOT run through?

Answers.Explanation: The Mississippi River forms the border between Iowa and Illinois
Wisconsin's southwestern border between Minnesota is formed by the Mississippi.
Indiana doesn't touch the Mississippi - but it's close - just a ways up the Ohio river from the Mississippi.

Questions.QuestionText: Which of the Great Lakes is the largest?

Answers.Explanation: Technically, Lakes Superior, Michigan and Huron form one SUPERLAKE, but they are generally considered separate. In any case, Superior is the most superior.
Lake Huron is huge, but not the biggest.
Ontario is the smallest, though it's still really freakin' big
Lake Erie is not the biggest, but it is the one nearest to Cleveland. Yay!
Lake Michigan is pretty big, but not the biggest. It is the longest of the Great Lakes, though, and the only one entirely in the US.

EndScreen.Message: The US is a huge and varied country!
